Bühler Honey, uncooked (grain), venison, land, roots, fruits, (a promise of) safety, a pasture for cattle, a house, and fodder for a draught-ox may be accepted (even) from an Ugra. 1 हरदत्त-टीका सूत्रम् मध्वामं मार्गं मांसं भूमिर् मूलफलानि रक्षा-गव्यूतिर्-निवेशनं युग्यघासश् चोग्रतः प्रतिगृह्याणि ॥ १ ॥ प्रस्तावः एवं तावन्निमित्तदुष्टं जातिदुष्टं कालदुष्टं चाऽभोज्यमुक्तम् । तत्र निमित्तदुष्टं यस्य कुले म्रियेते(पृ.

Bühler A drunkard, a madman, a prisoner, he who learns the Veda from his son, a creditor who sits with his debtor (hindering the fulfilment of his duties), a debtor who thus sits (with his creditor, are persons whose food must not be eaten) as long as they are thus engaged or in that state.
